page.title: 01Farmland SW of Thornton Dale
page.content:
An area of low lying fertile farmland. Fairly heavy clay soil. Part of Pickering Lake following Ice Age. About a dozen farms. Fields mainly long and narrow still showing effect of medieval strips. Drainage very important. Yorkshire Water Board draining machines very active. Many hedges grubbed out to make larger fields more suited to modern machines. Majority area cultivated cereals - rootcrops - sugarbeet - brassilas. Sheep and cattle - both stock and milk herds. Large quantities of hay produced for winter feed. Majority straw burnt in fields.
A170, main road to Scarborough, runs along northern boundary but only narrow farm roads in block.
